intro: Allophylus quinatus, commonly known as the African holly, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its opposite, simple, ovate leaves that are often glossy and dark green. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by red, fleshy fruits that are edible for some animals. Allophylus quinatus is adapted to a variety of soil types and can thrive in both full sun and partial shade.
